sources.title: Valkey GLIDE GitHub Repository - Main README
keyInsights: GLIDE is the official Valkey client with Rust core and multi-language bindings
Supports Valkey 7.2-9.0 and Redis 6.2-7.2
Key features: AZ affinity, PubSub auto-reconnection, sharded PubSub, cluster scan, batching, OpenTelemetry
Production-ready with 104+ contributors and Apache 2.0 license
Latest version v2.2.7 (Feb 2026) with mTLS and IAM auth

sources.title: GLIDE Node.js Client README
keyInsights: Installation: npm i @valkey/valkey-glide
Requires Node.js 20+, npm 11+ recommended
Supports Linux (glibc/musl) and macOS (x86_64/arm64)
GlideClient for standalone, GlideClusterClient for cluster mode
Full TypeScript support with protobufjs/minimal dependency

sources.title: GLIDE Official Documentation Site
keyInsights: Rust-based multi-language client library
Supports Python, Java, Node.js, Go, PHP, C# (coming soon)
High performance and low latency design
Migration guides available for popular clients

sources.title: GLIDE Node.js Language Documentation
keyInsights: Node.js 16+ required (updated: 20+ in v2.3)
Platform support for Linux and macOS
Engine compatibility: Valkey 7.2-9.0, Redis 6.2-7.0
protobufjs/minimal reduces bundle size to ~6.5KB gzipped

sources.title: GLIDE Node.js Wrapper Wiki - Full API Reference
keyInsights: GlideClient and GlideClusterClient detailed API
Authentication: username/password, IAM with auto-refresh
TLS modes: basic, insecure, custom certificates, mTLS
Batch API: atomic (transaction) and non-atomic (pipeline)
Read strategies: primary, preferReplica, AZAffinity, AZAffinityReplicasAndPrimary
OpenTelemetry traces and metrics integration
GlideString type, Decoder options, RESP2/RESP3 protocol support

sources.title: GLIDE General Concepts Wiki
keyInsights: Asynchronous multiplex connection architecture - single connection per node
Separate clients needed for blocking commands, WATCH, and large values
Lazy connect defers connection until first command
Multi-slot commands split and routed automatically in cluster
Batch API unifies transactions and pipelines
Inflight request limit: default 1000

sources.title: Migration Guide: ioredis to GLIDE
keyInsights: Connection setup differences: single config object vs multiple constructors
Multi-argument commands change to array parameters
Object-based parameters for hset, zadd
Return value changes: 1/0 to true/false for boolean commands
SETEX/SETNX replaced with set() options
Transaction migration: multi/exec to Batch(true)
Script class with automatic caching replaces manual EVALSHA

sources.title: GLIDE Wiki Index
keyInsights: 18 wiki pages covering all aspects of GLIDE
Migration guides for redis-py, ioredis, go-redis, Jedis, Lettuce, Redisson, StackExchange.Redis
Wiki being deprecated in favor of glide.valkey.io

sources.title: BaseClient.ts - Core Client Implementation
keyInsights: BaseClientConfiguration interface with all config options
GlideReturnType union type covering all possible return values
PubSub implementation: callback and polling patterns
Protobuf-based command serialization to Rust core
PointerResponse class for 64-bit pointer splitting across FFI
Connection backoff: exponential with jitter formula

sources.title: GlideClient.ts - Standalone Client
keyInsights: GlideClient extends BaseClient for standalone mode
PubSubSubscriptions with Exact and Pattern modes
Database operations: select, dbsize, flushdb, flushall
Function management: load, delete, flush, dump, restore
Scan with cursor-based iteration

sources.title: GlideClusterClient.ts - Cluster Client
keyInsights: GlideClusterClient with auto-topology discovery
periodicChecks configuration for topology refresh
Sharded PubSub mode (Valkey 7.0+)
Routing types: SlotId, SlotKey, RouteByAddress, allPrimaries, allNodes
ClusterResponse type for multi-node results
Function and script routing with route options

sources.title: Commands.ts - Full Command Definitions
keyInsights: Complete command coverage: String, Hash, List, Set, Sorted Set, Stream, Bitmap, HyperLogLog, PubSub, Scripting, Server
create{Command}() pattern returning protobuf Command objects
Rich option types: SetOptions, ZAddOptions, StreamAddOptions, etc.
Range types: RangeByIndex, RangeByScore, RangeByLex
Hash expiry commands: HExpire, HPExpire, HExpireAt, HPExpireAt

sources.title: Batch.ts - Transaction and Pipeline API
keyInsights: BaseBatch<T> generic class with isAtomic flag
200+ chained command methods
setCommandsIndexes for set-type conversion tracking
Supports both atomic (MULTI/EXEC) and non-atomic (pipeline) modes

sources.title: Errors.ts - Error Type Hierarchy
keyInsights: ValkeyError abstract base class
ClosingError: client permanently closed
RequestError > TimeoutError, ExecAbortError, ConnectionError, ConfigurationError
Pre-instantiated TIMEOUT_ERROR constant

sources.title: Logger.ts - Logging Configuration
keyInsights: Six log levels: error, warn, info, debug, trace, off
init() vs setLoggerConfig() methods
File output with name postfix or console output
Auto-initialization on first log if not explicitly configured

sources.title: OpenTelemetry.ts - Observability Integration
keyInsights: Singleton pattern - init() callable once per process
Traces with configurable sampling (0-100%, default 1%)
Metrics with configurable flush interval (default 5000ms)
Supports http, https, grpc, file:// protocols
Runtime sampling control via setSamplePercentage()

sources.title: index.ts - Public API Exports
keyInsights: Exports: BaseClient, Batch, Commands, Errors, GlideClient, GlideClusterClient, Logger, OpenTelemetry
Server modules: GlideFt, GlideFtOptions, GlideJson
Native bindings re-exported from build-ts/native

sources.title: GlideJson.ts - JSON Module API
keyInsights: 22 JSON commands: set, get, mget, del, arrappend, arrinsert, arrpop, etc.
Array operations: arrinsert, arrpop, arrappend, arrlen, arrtrim, arrindex
Object operations: objlen, objkeys
Numeric: numincrby, nummultby
Utility: clear, resp, debugMemory, debugFields

sources.title: GlideFt.ts - Search/FT Module API
keyInsights: 13 search commands: create, search, aggregate, dropindex, info, list, etc.
Index management: create, drop, alias, list
Query: search with pagination, aggregate with GROUPBY/SORTBY/FILTER
Profiling: profileSearch, profileAggregate
Query plan: explain, explaincli

sources.title: GlideFtOptions.ts - Search Configuration Types
keyInsights: Field types: TextField, TagField, NumericField, VectorField
Vector algorithms: FLAT (brute force) and HNSW (approximate)
FtCreateOptions: dataType (JSON/HASH), prefixes, schema
FtSearchOptions: returnFields, timeout, params, limit, count
FtAggregateOptions: clauses (LIMIT, FILTER, GROUPBY, SORTBY, APPLY)

sources.title: Rust Core lib.rs - Architecture Overview
keyInsights: Core modules: client, iam, pubsub, request_type
Conditional socket-layer compilation
Compression utilities (zstd/lz4)
Cluster scan container and scripts container
OpenTelemetry integration via GlideOpenTelemetry

sources.title: Node.js Rust Bindings - NAPI Bridge
keyInsights: NAPI-RS bindings with #[napi] procedural macros
Dedicated Tokio runtime in separate thread
Pointer splitting: 64-bit to 2x32-bit for JavaScript Numbers
AsyncClient wraps MultiplexedConnection with Runtime
Deferred promises bridge async Rust to JS Promises
resp_value_to_js() converts RESP values to JavaScript types

sources.title: Rust Core Client Module
keyInsights: ClientWrapper enum: Standalone, Cluster, Lazy
Lazy initialization pattern with get_or_initialize_client()
Single-threaded Tokio runtime via GlideRt
Dynamic routing: random -> RandomPrimary for writes
Inflight requests: AtomicIsize with default 1000 limit
IAM token manager with callback refresh
PubSub synchronizer for subscription tracking
Blocking command timeout extraction with 0.5s buffer

sources.title: Reconnecting Connection Implementation
keyInsights: Infinite backoff iteration for reconnection
Three connection states: Connected, Reconnecting, InitializedDisconnected
PING health check after each reconnection attempt
ReconnectReason: ConnectionDropped vs CreateError
Permanent errors (auth failures) halt retries; transient errors continue

sources.title: Request Type Definitions - Full Command Coverage
keyInsights: 380+ command variants as Rust enum

Categories: String(22), Hash(27), List(22), Set(17), Sorted Set(35), Stream(21), Bitmap(7), HyperLogLog(3), PubSub(20), Scripting(20), Cluster(28), Server(62), Generic(30), Connection(19), Transaction(5), JSON(22), Search(13), Geo(10)
CustomCommand for user-defined commands
Protobuf conversion layer for cross-language integration

sources.title: Rust Core Dependencies (Cargo.toml)
keyInsights: tokio v1 async runtime
Forked redis-rs for Redis protocol handling
rustls v0.23 with aws-lc-rs for TLS
AWS SDK crates for IAM auth
protobuf v3 for Node.js communication
zstd and lz4 for compression
tokio-retry2 for retry logic with jitter

sources.title: GLIDE Changelog
keyInsights: v2.3: Node.js 20+ required (16/18 dropped), mTLS support
v2.2: IAM authentication, TLS, seed-based topology refresh
v2.1: Hash field expiration, Alpine Linux support, multi-DB cluster
Node.js-specific fixes: circular imports, napi value conversion, npm publishing

sources.title: GLIDE Release History
keyInsights: Regular release cadence with GPG-signed commits
v2.2.7 (Feb 2026): topology refresh reliability
v2.2.5: TCPNoDelay option, Rust 2024 compatibility
v2.2.0: Major release with IAM auth and Windows Java support

sources.title: Node.js Developer Guide
keyInsights: Hybrid TypeScript + Rust architecture via napi-rs
Protobuf communication between Node and Rust layers
Build modes: release, benchmark, development
Three test suites: standard, minimal, module-specific
ESLint + Prettier for TS, Clippy + rustfmt for Rust

sources.title: Node.js Package Configuration
keyInsights: Package: @valkey/valkey-glide, Apache-2.0
Dependencies: protobufjs v7, long v5
Entry: build-ts/index.js with types
Six target architectures for native binaries
Multi-stage build: protobuf -> Rust -> TypeScript

sources.title: TypeScript Configuration
keyInsights: Target: ESNext, Module: CommonJS
Strict mode enabled (full type safety)
Declaration files generated
esModuleInterop for CJS/ESM compatibility

sources.title: Node.js Benchmark Suite
keyInsights: Compares GLIDE vs ioredis vs node-redis
Measures GET/SET latency: P50, P90, P99, avg, stddev, TPS
Workload: 80% reads, 20% writes
Configurable: data size, concurrency, cluster mode, TLS
Results output as JSON/CSV

sources.title: GlideClient Test Suite
keyInsights: Tests across RESP2 and RESP3 protocols
Batch testing: atomic and non-atomic modes
Decoder flexibility: String and Bytes
WATCH/transaction conflict handling
Lazy connection and timeout tests
Configuration examples: requestTimeout, inflightRequestsLimit, lazyConnect, tcpNoDelay

sources.title: GlideClusterClient Test Suite
keyInsights: Routing tests: randomNode, primarySlotKey, replicaSlotKey, allPrimaries, allNodes
AZ-affinity testing with availability-zone configuration
Failover and connection timeout scenarios
Inflight request limit validation
Cross-slot error handling

sources.title: PubSub Test Suite
keyInsights: Three subscription modes: Exact, Pattern, Sharded
Three consumption methods: async polling, sync polling, callback
Reconnection and cleanup verification
256+ channel sharded PubSub stress tests
RESP3 protocol requirement for push notifications
Binary decoder (Decoder.Bytes) support verification

sources.title: Test Utilities - Configuration Helpers
keyInsights: Default config: RESP3, TLS from global flag, requestTimeout 1000ms
Server version detection for both Valkey and Redis
Cleanup: socket release delays (50ms TLS, 10ms non-TLS)
Endpoint parsing: host:port format

sources.title: AZ Affinity Strategy Blog Post
keyInsights: Four read strategies: PRIMARY, PREFER_REPLICA, AZ_AFFINITY, AZ_AFFINITY_REPLICAS_AND_PRIMARY
Cross-AZ latency: 500-1000us reduced to ~300us with AZ affinity
Cost savings example: $4,373 to $1,088/month (75% reduction)
GLIDE is the only client supporting AZ affinity (at time of writing)
Requires availability-zone server config and clientAz client config

sources.title: Valkey GLIDE Go Client Announcement
keyInsights: Go uses CGO to call C functions generated from Rust core via Cbindgen
Single multiplexed connection per node (not connection pooling)
Thread-safe, concurrent usage through pipelined multiplexed connection
Consistent behavior across all language implementations

sources.title: GLIDE Known Issues
keyInsights: glibc 2.26, 2.27, 2.30, 2.31 NOT supported
Affected: Debian 11, Ubuntu 20.04, Amazon Linux 2
Error: GLIBC_2.34 not found
musl-based distros (Alpine) unaffected
Tracking issue: #3291

sources.title: Node.js GitHub Issues Search
keyInsights: Docker decoder errors in containerized environments
Class extension failures with module loading
Missing type exports
Non-blocking connection feature request
Node.js 16/18 EOL removal
ElastiCache serverless + IAM auth request

sources.title: Benchmark Documentation
keyInsights: install_and_test.sh benchmark runner
Results written to CSV in ./results folder
Configurable data sizes (100, 4000 bytes)
Known issue: Redis crashes at 4000 data-size with low storage

sources.title: AWS Blog: Introducing Valkey GLIDE
keyInsights: AWS introduced GLIDE for ElastiCache and MemoryDB users
Categorized as intermediate (200-level) technical content
Positioned as open-source client for both Valkey and Redis

sources.title: Server Modules Directory
keyInsights: Three modules: GlideFt.ts, GlideJson.ts, GlideFtOptions.ts
JSON and Search/FT module support
Modular architecture for server-side extensions
